entry.title: My Writing is in Disarray
entry.content: In some ways, the title says it all.
entry.summary: In some ways, the title says it all.

entry.title: My Blog
entry.content: As I continue to work with my files, I have been thinking a lot about this blog. I have entries that are over fifteen years old. Rereading these is entertaining. I remind myself of things that happened that I have forgotten. I suppose that is the point of writing: to make a record that I can refer to at some time in the future. But here’s the thing: Is anyone going to scroll back that far to read these entries?
entry.summary: As I continue to work with my files, I have been thinking a lot about this blog. I have entries that are over fifteen years old. Rereading these is entertaining. I remind myself of things that happened that I have forgotten. I suppose that is the point of writing: to make a record that I can refer to at some time in the future. But here’s the thing: Is anyone going to scroll back that far to read these entries?

entry.title: Great Day
entry.content: Today is a great day for Nick and me.
entry.summary: Today is a great day for Nick and me.

entry.title: I Think I have it!
entry.content: Yesterday I wrote a post lamenting the fact that I could not get ablog to work. Well, without any much customization, I think I have it. Anyway, what I have is working even if it is not elegant.
entry.summary: Yesterday I wrote a post lamenting the fact that I could not get ablog to work. Well, without any much customization, I think I have it. Anyway, what I have is working even if it is not elegant.

entry.title: GPS Uncertainties
entry.content: With the air quality, pollen counts and risk of infection, I have not been going anywhere by myself. Basically, I’m not going anywhere, even by car. I have to push myself to get out of the house and take a walk. This is sad for Nick.
entry.summary: With the air quality, pollen counts and risk of infection, I have not been going anywhere by myself. Basically, I’m not going anywhere, even by car. I have to push myself to get out of the house and take a walk. This is sad for Nick.

entry.title: Insecurity
entry.content: I don’t think I’ve ever been a relaxed person, living in the moment, content. I’m either looking ahead or looking back.
entry.summary: I don’t think I’ve ever been a relaxed person, living in the moment, content. I’m either looking ahead or looking back.

entry.title: Setting up Ablog
entry.content: This has been difficult for me. I went down a number of alleys which did not lead to joy. In the end, I decided on a very generic presentation so that ablog works.
entry.summary: This has been difficult for me. I went down a number of alleys which did not lead to joy. In the end, I decided on a very generic presentation so that ablog works.

entry.title: Entry Points
entry.content: I remember when people used paper road maps. Most gas stations stocked them. They were free for the asking. After all, gas stations were the places you most frequently asked for directions. No GPS was available. Satellites orbiting Earth were just starting to be a thing.
entry.summary: I remember when people used paper road maps. Most gas stations stocked them. They were free for the asking. After all, gas stations were the places you most frequently asked for directions. No GPS was available. Satellites orbiting Earth were just starting to be a thing.

entry.title: Our Walk was Crazy Today
entry.content: Our walk was crazy today. Nick was a smart alec for sure.
entry.summary: Our walk was crazy today. Nick was a smart alec for sure.

entry.title: Using EWW on Emacs
entry.content: Since eww stands for Emacs Web Wowser (No, I’m not kidding!) putting Emacs in the title of this piece is redundant. I figured EWW might just not be a term whose definition would easily come to mind. I couldn’t resist wowser in any case.
